text: is a railway station on the Hokuriku Main Line in the city of Sakai, Fukui Prefecture, Japan, operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West). ==Lines== Harue Station is served by the Hokuriku Main Line, and is located 108.1 kilometers from the terminus of the line at . ==Station layout== The station consists of one island platform connected by a footbridge. The station is staffed. ===Platforms=== == Adjacent stations == ==History== Harue Station opened on May 1, 1926. With the privatization of Japanese National Railways (JNR) on 1 April 1987, the station came under the control of JR West. ==Passenger statistics== In fiscal 2016, the station was used by an average of 1,003 passengers daily (boarding passengers only). ==Surrounding area== *Harue Elementary School *Harue Middle School ==See also== * List of railway stations in Japan ==References== ==External links== * Category:Railway stations in Fukui Prefecture Category:Stations of West Japan Railway Company Category:Railway stations in Japan opened in 1926 Category:Hokuriku Main Line Category:Sakai, Fukui
title: Harue Station
